member.summary: Gets or sets the default file name extension applied to files that are saved with the .
member.value: The default file name extension applied to files that are saved with the , which can optionally include the dot character (.).
member.remarks: The default file name extension is applied when the selected filter does not specify an extension (or the Filter property is not set) and the user does not specify an extension. member.name: P:InTheHand.Windows.Controls.SaveFileDialog.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the current file name filter string, which determines the choices that appear in the "Save as file type" or "Files of type" box in the dialog box.
member.value: The file filtering options available in the dialog box.
member.remarks:
For each filtering option, the filter string contains a description of the filter, followed by the vertical bar (|) and the filter pattern. The strings for different filtering options are separated by the vertical bar.
The following is an example of a filter string: Text files (*.txt)|*.txt|All files (*.*)|*.*
You can add several filter patterns to a filter by separating the file types with semicolons, for example: Image Files(*.BMP;*.JPG;*.GIF)|*.BMP;*.JPG;*.GIF|All files (*.*)|*.*
Use the FilterIndex property to set which filtering option is shown first to the user.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Windows.Controls.SaveFileDialog.FilterIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the filter currently selected in the file dialog box.
member.value: A value containing the index of the filter currently selected in the file dialog box. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: Use the FilterIndex property to set which filtering option is used. On Windows Mobile the user cannot change the filter themselves. The index of the first item in the Filter list is 1.
